abstract.p: Both US teams are in qualifying positions at World Bridge Championships in Maastricht, Netherlands (S)

block.p: Both United States teams were in qualifying positions at the World Bridge Championships here today.

The open team began the day in fifth position in its qualifying pool of 18 teams, of which 4 will qualify for playoffs next week. The Americans won their next two matches, 20-10 against Guadeloupe and 25-1 against Luxemburg. After seven rounds their total was 128, tied for third place with a dark-horse Lebanon team. Leading in the pool are Australia, with 153, and Finland, with 131. Leading in the other three pools are Britain, Italy and an unheralded Belgian team.

The American women's team lost its first match today, 13-17 against Brazil, but bounced back by winning maximum points against Spain, 25-3. After eight rounds its score of 132 put it in 7th position in its pool of 20 teams, 8 of which will qualify for playoffs. Norway, with 171, leads the group. France leads the other pool with 162.
